reviews.text: Very nice complex offering outdoor nature trail in rural and urban environments as well as a museum. We love to ride the trails and eat in downtown Augusta. Great day trip.

Canal boat Excursion up the canal I'm bad what's nice scenery was pretty good historic sites along the way with laceration only negative was part of Route was blocked because of work being done so trip shortened and narration was unnecessary on return trip would have been better just to have the quiet and scenery to enjoy on the return trip it was nice to have the Discovery Center to explore prior to the Excursion on the canal also the Discovery Center and Canal Excursion Associates were all very pleasant a knowledgeable
Very interesting place to visit.. full of history and a super sweet and funny staff. Definitely recommend it for a day with the kids.

It is a cute little museum. They have a short intro film when you first get there to give you some background info on the canal. Then, they have exhibits detailing the building of the canal and the impact the canal had on the local area. There are some neat interactive exhibits and some more short films about the factories that rose up because of the canal. They also have a very nice gift shop with very reasonable prices. You can also buy tickets for boat tours of the canal at the museum. The boat tour is fun and very educational. I would recommend the museum and the boat tour, especially if you want to learn about the local area and its history.
The canal was in the process of cleaning. We enjoyed the walk and the history that came with it.

My family has a long history with Springfield Baptist Church my grandmother's name is on one of the cornerstones. The Historic Church celebrated is 230th anniversary in August of 2018,  that block of 12th Street on which it stands what is change to Springfield way.
Wonderfully HISTORIC!!! Home of Morehouse.
Friendly loving people. They do a lot gor the Community
Always a welcoming sweet Spirit in worship and fellowship.
One of the only churches where you can know all the members.

I love going to the museum, I love that they change the artwork a few time of the year.  IT IS FREE ON SUNDAYS! The gift shop is great! They have jewelry, new books, discounted books, scarves, shirts decorations for the home and so much more. My boyfriend and I try and go every Sunday to see what new books they have for me to read...im a bookworm🤓
Small museum with nice selection of various medians of paintings.  Great gift shop.  Seniors, military $3.00.  Others $5.00.  Great value.
I loved the fact that you were able to attend a mini concert for free.  I loved every minute of it.
I loved how fresh the ingredients were for the slice of pizza I had. Very good
Lovely permanent collection of Southern art. Usually a good featured show every couple of months. Free on Sunday!
Beautiful venue for a wedding!  Everyone was very polite , and answered any questions or concerns we had! I highly recommend  The Enterprise Mill  for a wedding or any event!
A cozy place to hold a venue. Rustic looking.
Best place to have an event,.very professional ...Love this place.

Went to a wedding there, and it was beautiful :) Nice ceremony in the outdoor brick-enclosed area, and beautiful indoor reception right next to it. There's a lot you can do with the room to decorate it how you'd like. Only drawback was that the bathrooms weren't close to the room. But otherwise great!

Heather and staff were great, this was a fantastic place to hold a wedding, the loft that is now available for the Bride and Bridesmaids to get ready was the best, they did a great job on it. Food was pricey but worth it. We had a blast

Visited this place during a school field trip to my then elementary school child. Beautiful place. With lots of history. It was during the springtime and their were so many beautiful places to take pictures. All I can remember
My cousin got married here. It's a very traditional building. Nice for a small wedding or gathering.  My cousin loved it, and we had the time of our lives.
Very nice venue we visited for a friend's wedding, it was decorated for the holidays. A great historic venue
Love visiting Santa here!
Beautiful Wedding

Beautiful, well kept trails with boardwalk. It's a different side of Augusta for those who haven't seen it, lots of birds and wild life. I would definitely recommend so bug spray during warm days. There's a playground, bathrooms and water fountain for little ones as well as other buildings but I'm not sure what those are. Overall it's a good place to spend 30 minutes for a good hike or a few hours for more!

It feels like there are miles of pathways to explore through beautiful marshland.

We saw about 20 bird species, 3 species of turtle, beaver and otter sign, and some spectacular native wildflowers on a 2 hour walk yesterday.
Capped of by a kestrel catching a snake.

It was quiet except for the bird song and our conversation. 

Always a wonderful time for any one interested in biology, ecology, or photography.

This place is really cool! We were shocked when we saw our first alligator let alone the several we saw afterwards. Lots of nature, a beautiful walk, and exciting to see the alligators. I did end up going back around the pond the way I came when I saw one super close. Not that it would do anything to me, but I am a better to be safe than sorry type of person.

Wonderful place to experience nature in a controlled environment. Large numbers and variety of birds, as well as a chance to see the odd alligator or two. Excellent for school-age children to get a feel for wetlands.

We stopped by this place while on the way home to Atlanta. After having been in the car for 3 hours, strolling around the vast nature park was a welcome break. There are signs warning of alligators everywhere though we didn't see any on our trip but we did see a host of other wildlife. Be ready to walk and make sure your kids are within eyesight and bring a camera to capture the beauty of this park.

This place has a pretty cool vibe. I ordered the coconut curry large plate. Meal was pretty tasty. Only thing I’d improve is the vegetables that are added cost, and there wasn’t that much, also a bit too much coconut milk was used in the curry for my taste. Overall it’s a good spot that i’d visit again

Great small plates- this place is really best with a smallish group of people- get a bunch of plates and share. The fries are amazing w/ the aioli, and they have a lot of vegetarian options if you want that. Super cheap to eat a lot of food if you are splitting with other people.

Solid place to dine in downtown Augusta. The food was full of flavor. I would of liked to see better seafood execution and more options. The steak tacos and pork nachos were great! I would definately recommend.

The Bee's Knee's was delightful tonight but what was even more delightful was David Baldwin. David Baldwin is a saint and is the best server I've ever had in my life. I hope that I always get him when I come here and I hope that my servers at future establishments can be half as good.

The atmosphere is cozy and the food was served hot and fresh. Try their chicken and waffle in which it was delicious and the waitress we had last night she waitress was very professional. We definitely will be going back.

I had a great meal and experience here. The staff were prompt, caring, and attentive. Food was excellent and the portions perfect. Really enjoyed the small community environment. Great place for a date with my wife as we both enjoyed our meals and our service. The food quality is higher than most of the surrounding area and not overpriced. Highly recommended.

I had the breakfast buffet this morning and cannot justify the price with what I got. The atmosphere is pleasant and the staff were nice, but the food was underwhelming. The bacon was beyond crispy, sausage links were overcooked, eggs reminded of Army mess hall eggs. The shrimp and grits were very bland. The French toast was pretty delicious, however, not requiring syrup at all. At the price tag, I would rather go to Golden Corral, where at least I would have more options.
A beautiful little place to grab lunch or dinner. The food is always spectacular and surprising. The owner is great we had one issue and they took care of it immediately. Must visit.

Adore this place. It’s delicious. Timely and friendly service. Quaint atmosphere. (The BLT on Brioche is yummier than on the multigrain bread in my opinion and they are glad to change it out for me). I highly recommend Manuel’s!

The server was amazing. Ashley is not only beautiful, but a good person. Was honored to have her serve us. The burger was overdone and the salt on the fries needed to be done im a separate bowl, then into their respective containers. May want to swap the position of the vegetables in the burger to be below the meat. That way the customer gets the juices caught from the burger rather than it soaking the bread. Take your time and dont rush it. Then the success will follow. Good job and good luck!
We enjoyed the food and service! Was not used to Italian sausage in pasta sauce, not my taste. The rest of the food was very good and came out in a timely manner!
A really super experience. I hadn't been there in 20 years. A refreshing trip back to unique family-owned restaurants. Worth your time!

Luigi's is only open for lunch on Friday so we took advantage of the opportunity to change things up. Like a step back in time. An Augusta tradition for many years. A family owned restaurant similar to what you might have found in New York City or Chicago in the 40's.. Features wonderful fresh Greek and Italian cuisine. Great pizza. Greek style chicken and with a quarter you can play music from the music box right at your table. Lunch features either 1/2 order pasta dished or you can order from the full menu. The owner, Penny "Mama" Luigi was out front as usual but she left before we could speak to her. Tired of chain restaurants? Give Luigi's a shot. I promise you'll go back again.

Sorry to do this the a good staff, but the food was not good at all. The best thing was garlic bread.  We had to send back both of our meals.  We ordered chicken parm with Alfredo over pasta and the mashed potatoes with peppers. It was terrible!
Classic Italian/Greek restaurant if there was one. The service was amazing and very accommodating to my friend

Great atmosphere, service and setting.  The food was fabulous! We all liked the brisket better than the pulled pork.  We each got the plantation platter to share because we wanted to try it all. Great sweet pickles!

We shared the Plantation platter with ribs, beef, chopped pork, & chicken, with hash/rice.  None had a pit cooked flavor....no hickory or smoked flavor.  Chopped pork was the best.  As a southerner, I feel I have enjoyed some fantastic BBQ....this wasn't.  Took one taste of the hash and no more.  The atmosphere is fine, the attire of the servers way out of date, but the server was nice and very personable.  Wouldn't recommend.
Excellent food and service was always!!!  Never had a bad experience.  They also catered my wedding in 2017 and again, outstanding service and food.

Best. BBQ. Ever.  No one makes hash like Larry Sconyers! This is my absolute favorite place to eat bbq and the only place I eat hash and rice. I grew up on this barbecue. The prices are more than reasonable and the quantities are generous.  They are only open on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. Sconyers is a tradition in Augusta. And one I highly recommend!!!!
I haven't been in 5 years.  The service is beyond measure.  I forgot how good this bbq is.  The portions are awesome.  The price is on point as well.

We ate at French Market Grille in the Surrey Center on 2/13/19 and had a delicious dinner.  Everything was perfectly prepared with attention to detail.  Our server was Cory and he was phenomenal!  He made the experience even more pleasant and he never stopped looking out for the needs of each guest.   I highly recommend this establishment.

This was a nice place with a nice atmosphere. Our server was phenomenal. The dinner rolls were my favorite part. I got the steak and lobster and it was just ok. My husband got a crab chop and it was lackluster with no real crab flavor. He really loved the mint vinaigrette on his salad.

What can I say other than perfection at its best. If you want authentic Cajun food like in New Orleans, this is the place to go and their gumbo and oysters are to die for. Service is excellent and the food is brought to you in a timely manner and most importantly,  hot.

My server was amazing, probably the best part of the experience. Ordered the mint vinaigrette on my and loved it. The crab chop was a huge disappointment however. The crab meat was just a mangled mess so it didn't hold much crab flavor. If you've ever had a crab cake, this will just upset you. The wife ordered a steak and lobster. For the price, you'd think that the tail would be of decent size but it wasn't. Had the dessert sampler, and they were obviously frozen cheese cakes. I can't say that any of it was gross, but for the price and the fanfare, I can't say what makes it worth going to.

I just had higher expectations for a 30 dollar meal restaurant 
Both of our meals were over cooked, very dry.
My fish was not fried well at all. Patato's were very dry and old looking. Very surprising that they would even serve them. Low standards from the cook , I had all fried food and nothing wet on my plate but yet everything was soggy on the bottom. ( didn't drain oil before plating)
I paid for a 4 star meal and received a Second rate one at best
$110.00 w/ drinks was left on the plate so needless to say I was disappointed 
Service was great
Was a nice place near Firestone, the food was good. Cookies were nice and soft. Watch prices, can add up quickly.

Hidden GEM. hiding in plain sight. On Broad Street. Delicious lunch, great service, AND???? COOKIES. COOOKIES. rainbow, thumbprints, macaroons, wrinkles, and, and, and... Lots of plants, homey atmosphere, did I say? Great food. Fan. Right here. You might want to be, too.
Honestly- very delicious. Grandma style “old world” cookies that remind you of holidays and baked with love. 100% recommend.

Charged my mother,  76 year old woman $12 for a bread mayo lettuce and tomato sandwich!! When I called to asked about this issue  I was laughed at and brushed off. What a lack of compassion!! They may have good food my mother only ate bread....and who wants to do business with people who pray on the elderly!! Masters' customers beware!!
Steeped in history and oh so good. The bicentennial is unmatched.

Food and drinks are pretty consistant with each visit. It's an ease of mind for me to expect to get what I am ordering. They have the best ice for your drinks in my opinion which may sound silly, but you'll just have to try it for yourself. Coffee is fresh and food is good. Just be prepared to wait for a table on the mornings of the weekends.

This is perhaps the most popular hangover cure/breakfast spot in town.

One thing you will always notice about the Deli is that the coworkers seem to absolutely love each other and it shows through their service attitudes. 

Ask them and they will tell you their favorite part about their job is all of their coworkers. This is exactly what you want in a work environment as it keeps employees engaged, empowered, and most importantly in this setting providing customers with excellent service. 

The potatoes are my personal favorite to order from the Deli and I encourage you to feast on their super sized pancakes if you have the large appetite that I do!

I will also note that if you ever have to wait, it is well worth it.

I felt the food was mediocre and so was the service. My family and I waited 30 minutes for our food with no explanation. Food should have been HOT when it came out but was warm at best. The server clearly forgot to put our order in and tried to play it off. I would not recommend this establishment nor will I be back.
Last bite was as delicious as the first! Got the Breakfast Tacos, would DEFINITELY recommend! Will for sure be coming back in the future.

Point of this review, Mandy, is you hurt my feeling and I'm left hungry. 

KISS (Keep it simple (for) stupid) should be your model when placing your order at this confused diner.  The waitstaff are inattentive every time I have ever eaten here, probably due to Management preying on college students desperate for a job they can show up to hungover. 

Here's a short story for you.  I placed a carry out order this morning for a very simple, standard diner omelette: a western omelette and home fries. I get home, excited to pop some hot home fries in my mouth and they were cold! Cold home fries should have been a warning that something was off but my omelette was hot so there is hope. First cut into the eggs, I get that nice crisp egg from an American style omelette and a bit of tomato. I get a bit of wheat toast to go with the egg and to my dismay, it's just bread. Hmm, I'll just move this to the side and focus on this omelette, it's pretty good. Next, cut has more egg, tomato and this white stuff starts oozing out. I think to myself, do they put ricotta cheese in an omelette. Do they mean West Italy for their omelette? Nope, it was sour cream. Not just an accent of sour cream, I could probably deal with that and move on with my day. No, this was "Fill a Pringles Can" worth of sour cream. There must be a mistake here, I'll give them a call to sort it out. 

I place the call and the polite girl that took my order answers. I ask could there be a mistake with my order and the politeness fades instantly. She insists I ordered a Southwest Omelette and explains what's in it. I tell her that I ordered a western omelette and it shouldn't have sour cream. She doubles down and says that's what I ordered. At this point, I'm fed up with this service. She insists that I cannot bring it back and have it remade. I tipped this girl 25% on a carryout order because of the kindness she displayed initially. I am very disappointed in this establishment. 

If she was unwilling to have it remade, that tells me management is pressuring the staff to not fix errors. I hope that the alumni nostalgia of this diner is enough to keep your business running.
